comment:
His classes are low key insufferable in person. He babbles on and on about his time in the industry without really teaching anything. He is one of the better Machine Design and Senior Design professors, but don't expect to learn anything valuable. 
One main group project that is usally a waste of time with weekly homeworks and 2 exams.

One of the better professors I have ever had. His approach to teaching is different from most other professors. I took him For ME4141 and ME4250, both classes revolved around big projects and he would always provide good feedback every time you submitted a report update. He is a good ole boy and he's really easy to get along with.
His class is easy, but man is he a prick.

One of if not the best professor I have taken at KSU. Very knowledgeable about engineering will put you in a position to succeed in Senior Design if you take him. Clear expectations for project and gives individual group time with him most weeks to set you on the right schedule to accomplish what he expects.

Santana's always a good professor to choose with anything. He's very down-to-earth and funny! Honestly, this class was an easy A with him. His lectures were incredibly boring to me though, but he only sometimes took attendance. I would honestly skip because he doesn't give you time in class to work on your group project. Very lenient on grading!
HE IS GOOD PROFESSOR, AS LONG AS YOU APPLY YOURSELF AND STAY AHEAD ON YOUR HOMEWORK AND PROJECTS. PASSABLE WITH!!!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria

comment: My favorite professor so far. Graded mainly off of projects instead of homework and test, and the projects give some decent real-world application. You still have to put in the work, but it's not an unreasonable amount.

Take him every chance you get. Lots of real-world knowledge that he passes down to you. Lives by "the only dumb questions are the ones not asked". The difficulty level in his classes is fair. You work for your grade but if you're struggling he is very approachable and helpful. You'll learn a lot from him, best professor at KSU hands down.

Take Mr. Roberts every chance you get. He is a great teacher that teaches you what you will need to know when you actually get a job. His classes are normally project based and he typically dos not have tests.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Group projects

comment: Awesome professor, really knows his stuff and really funny

Makes way too many jokes for us to get through enough class material. At 1st it was cool but it got old quick. I just wanted to start using SolidWorks for analysis. Doesnt seem well prepared for classes. Assignments were random & class was disorganized. Hes a cool guy & really laid back. The projects we did were interesting & he graded easy.

Awesome professor that knows what he is doing . knows everything there is to know about solidworks Absolutely hilarious and makes lots of dad jokes in class. Assignments are really easy and as long as you show up for most of the classes and do all of the assignments you will make an A. there were 2 projects and a midterm, no final. great professor

Awesome professor, we would even play Call of duty mobile before class started. great feedback, and demonstration of what you did wrong and /or how to fix it also. didn't do much freehand drawing just jumped right into Solidworks. Final was our final project. lectures were fun, he cracks jokes all the time.

I wasn't too sure about taking this class at first since it was fully online, but I'm glad I did. Professor Roberts is great. He's young, so he's only taught 1 year, but he does a good job explaining concepts without overloading you with work. Just do the homework and it's an easy A
